subtitle: A whole new world for your baby
description: A whole new world for your baby
title: Your new baby
content:
Created by BabyCenter 


Your newborn is new to this big, noisy world! You can see he moves in a jerky way as he gets used to it. Soon, his movements will be smoother. 

You may worry your baby isn't getting enough milk. If your baby is feeding every 2 to 3 hours, or at least 8 times a day, then that is enough. The color of your baby's bowel movements is a good way to check. They are black at first and turn yellow by day 4.

Your baby can suck, grasp, blink and search for your nipple. Sometimes he will look straight into your eyes. It is good to respond by looking back and smiling and nodding.  He is learning fast!

At around 2 weeks, watch for your baby trying to lift his head when he's lying on his front. He might turn his head from side to side as well. This helps develop his neck muscles.  
	
As he approaches 1 month old, your baby begins to lose his newborn quiver and jumpiness.  He is growing stronger every day and learning about the world around him. 

One exciting change is he's beginning to make baby noises. This is his way of talking to you! Try and make baby noises back. Keep talking even when you put him down and move away. 

[When can I take my baby out of the house?][1]



  [1]: http://www.babycenter.com/404_when-can-i-take-my-baby-out-of-the-house_9946.bc
